intro: Roella latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaf roella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Roella latiloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
